title: A friend is one of the nicest things you can have, and one of the best things you can be. ~Douglas Pagels
head: Friendship

title: Most of us don’t need a psychiatric therapist as much as a friend to be silly with. ~Robert Brault
head: Friendship

title: Friendship isn’t a big thing — it’s a million little things. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: Friendship is like a rainbow between two hearts. ~Author unknown
head: Friendship

title: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world. ~Leo Buscaglia
head: Friendship

title: Only your real friends will tell you when your face is dirty. ~Sicilian Proverb
head: Friendship

title: The antidote for fifty enemies is one friend. ~Aristotle
head: Friendship

title: In everyone’s life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit. ~Albert Schweitzer
head: Friendship

title: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they’re not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they’re not so bad. ~Arnold H. Glasgow
head: Friendship

title: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you. ~Elbert Hubbard, The Notebook, 1927
head: Friendship

title: I don’t need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better. ~Plutarch
head: Friendship

title: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another’s little lapses. ~David Storey
head: Friendship

title: Do not keep on with a mockery of friendship after the substance is gone — but part, while you can part friends. Bury the carcass of friendship: it is not worth embalming. ~William Hazlitt
head: Friendship

title: It’s no good trying to keep up old friendships. It’s painful for both sides. The fact is, one grows out of people, and the only thing is to face it. ~Somerset Maugham
head: Friendship

title: Friends are like walls. Sometimes you lean on them, and sometimes it’s good just knowing they are there. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: In my friend, I find a second self. ~Isabel Norton
head: Friendship

title: A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him I may think aloud. I am arrived at last in the presence of a man so real and equal, that I may drop even those undermost garments of dissimulation, courtesy, and second thought, which men never put off, and may deal with him with the simplicity and wholeness with which one chemical atom meets another. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
head: Friendship

title: A good friend is cheaper than therapy. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: If a friend is in trouble, don’t annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it. ~Edgar Watson Howe
head: Friendship

title: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend. ~Henry David Thoreau
head: Friendship

title: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down. ~Arnold Glasow
head: Friendship

title: But if the while I think on thee, dear friend,All losses are restored and sorrows end.~William Shakespeare
head: Friendship

title: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart. ~Elisabeth Foley
head: Friendship

title: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend. ~William Blake
head: Friendship

title: A friend is the only person you will let into the house when you are Turning Out Drawers. ~Pam Brown
head: Friendship

title: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts. ~Margaret Lee Runbeck, Answer Without Ceasing
head: Friendship

title: Our most difficult task as a friend is to offer understanding when we don’t understand. ~Robert Brault, rbrault.blogspot.com
head: Friendship

title: The function of a friend is not to have a function. ~Detlef Cordes, detlefcordes.org
head: Friendship

title: As a friend, you first give your understanding, then you try to understand. ~Robert Brault, rbrault.blogspot.com
head: Friendship

title: The friend within the man is that part of him which belongs to you and opens to you a door which never, perhaps, is opened to another. Such a friend is true, and all he says is true; and he loves you even if he hates you in other mansions of his heart. ~Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Wisdom of the Sands, translated from French by Stuart Gilbert
head: Friendship

title: One’s friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human. ~George Santayana
head: Friendship

title: A friend knows the song in my heart and sings it to me when my memory fails. ~Donna Roberts
head: Friendship

title: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself alone. A man should keep his friendships in constant repair. ~Samuel Johnson
head: Friendship

title: True friendship comes when silence between two people is comfortable. ~Dave Tyson Gentry
head: Friendship

title: You can always tell a real friend: when you’ve made a fool of yourself he doesn’t feel you’ve done a permanent job. ~Laurence J. Peter
head: Friendship

title: Friends are those rare people who ask how you are and then wait for the answer. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: A friend is the one who comes in when the whole world has gone out. ~Grace Pulpit
head: Friendship

title: One doesn’t know, till one is a bit at odds with the world, how much one’s friends who believe in one rather generously, mean to one. ~D.H. Lawrence
head: Friendship

title: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival. ~C.S. Lewis
head: Friendship

title: Constant use will not wear ragged the fabric of friendship. ~Dorothy Parker
head: Friendship

title: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends. ~Virginia Woolf
head: Friendship

title: There are big ships and small ships. But the best ship of all is friendship. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: The best kind of friend is the one you could sit on a porch with, never saying a word, and walk away feeling like that was the best conversation you’ve had. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: I like friends who, when you tell them you need a moment alone, know enough not to stray too far. ~Robert Brault, rbrault.blogspot.com
head: Friendship

title: The language of friendship is not words but meanings. ~Henry David Thoreau
head: Friendship

title: A true friend is one who thinks you are a good egg even if you are half-cracked. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: Friends are kisses blown to us by angels. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: It’s important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to the friendship that we are not. ~Mignon McLaughlin, The Neurotic’s Notebook, 1960
head: Friendship

title: It is the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter. ~Marlene Dietrich
head: Friendship

title: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It’s good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind. ~Toni Morrison, Beloved
head: Friendship

title: Cherish the friend who tells you a harsh truth, wanting ten times more to tell you a loving lie. ~Robert Brault, rbrault.blogspot.com
head: Friendship

title: Friends can be said to fall in like with as profound a thud as romantic partners fall in love. ~Letty Cottin Pogrebin
head: Friendship

title: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend. ~Plautus
head: Friendship

title: A real friend is someone who would feel loss if you jumped on a train, or in front of one. ~Author Unknown
head: Friendship

title: What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies. ~Aristotle
head: Friendship

title: Friendship needs no words — it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness. ~Dag Hammarskjold
head: Friendship

title: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them. ~Francesco Guicciardini
head: Friendship

title: Friendship is Love with jewels on, but without either flowers or veil. ~Augustus William Hare and Julius Charles Hare, Guesses at Truth, by Two Brothers, 1827
head: Friendship

title: If I had to sum up Friendship in one word, it would be Comfort. ~Terri Guillemets
head: Friendship

title: I lay it down as a fact that if all men knew what others say of them, there would not be four friends in the world. ~Blaise Pascal
head: Friendship

title: A man’s growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
head: Friendship
